alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 9:48AM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near US-41 downstream to confluence with Sugar Creek at Watseka, including the Iroquois gauge. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural areas near the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain just below flood stage the next few days, with a small rise to near flood stage by Wednesday. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected tonight.
